Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: You learn the basics of music, from sheet music reading to harmony/melody to basic music analysis. Really gives you a better understanding/appreciation for music to listen to/play in day-to-day life.
I learned the basics of music theory and composition.
I developed basic music theory knowledge and became somewhat proficient with music making software.
By taking this course I learned to read music and gained a fundamental understanding of the core of pop music chord progression and the idea of intentional music choices.
Major minor keys, chords, chord progression and song structure.
I learn to train my ear, to analyze a music piece with basic music theory principles
Basic level music theory. The clefs, Roman numeral analysis, song structure. Super fun!

Weaknesses are that each section has a different instructor that does things differently- my class only got to do one composition during the entire semester. However, it is also nice that each instructor can tailor the class to their particular interests.

Begins very basic, so I felt like I had a foundation to build upon. It was a little quick towards the middle of the semester, but slowed down sufficiently so that we could go over everything we didn't know.
The strengths are that it is a small class and so you are able to engage better with the material and the professor really is understanding.
Good selection of material. Could have spent more time on developing melody lines.

I didn't pass the placement test to get placed in higher level courses, but the first half of the course was too easy. I wish there would be more ear training and less going over the principles mechanically because a lot of them were just simple calculations of the same stuff.
The course is intro level but there are people who take it that know more and make the pace a bit fast.
Yes! Great course if youre a beginner in music or want to get a better background in the concepts you already know.
Yes! If you are interested in music theory at all (I had no previous experience- but it is helpful to go into the class knowing the names of the notes).
Yes! It is a great class to take even for people with no musical background.
Yes i would, music surrounds us and plays a big role in our lives as human beings and it is important and interesting to understanding how this almost mysterious concept works.
Yes! Nice intro to music theory that will prepare you well for higher level classes.
Not to people who already have some background but it is a fun course.
